website_summaries.verdict: The Echo Spot is a fine for what it is, but Amazon still hasn't done enough to convince us that Alexa needs a touchscreen at all.
pros: The Echo Spot is a well-made device with a good-looking design, and it's handy for quick, voice-activated video calls
Sound quality was better than we expected, and noticeably better than the Echo Dot's
cons: The Echo Spot doesn't currently support YouTube, nor does it offer many video sources for your flash briefings
The touchscreen adds less than it should to the Alexa experience, and it's too small to be helpful unless you're within a few feet of the device

customer_reviews.title: Amazon should listen to its customers.
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 of these... amazon is ignoring its customers and using these devices as a marketing tool. You can customize the screen contents, but you cannot turn off there advertising, Things to Try... People will suggest that you can, but you can only do so if you turn off all content changes which is not an acceptable option. Moreover, they should increase the size slightly, and improve the audio speaker. That would give you a 5 star device. Right now i’m debating whether to return all 3 devices. My wife says we should.
customer_reviews.author: MP from NY

customer_reviews.title: "Try and ask Alexa" card is so irritating i cant even look at the screen, so now the screen faces the wall.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and I would give 5 stars - but you can't scroll face cards without having the stupid "try and ask Alexa" suggestions pop up. Yes you can have it scroll once, and just stay on the clock, but I like having other cards as well. God its the worst and SO irritating. I got it super cheap, so i just face the screen toward the wall and treat it like a Dot instead of a Spot. What a dumb move on Amazons​ part.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Sutton

customer_reviews.title: One major flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent smart device with one major flaw that makes it unbearable. There’s no way to deactivate “Things To Try”, which means you’re forced to watch on-screen tutorials of basic Alexa tips each time the Spot wakes up. It’s not possible to deactivate this “feature.”
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: I give up. Amazon has ruined a decent device.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon has officially ruined this device. I have recommended this device, in conjunction with the Amazon Cloud Cam for months. The best reason to own this device is to use it as a baby monitor. With recent changes to the display, it is useless. It now has an on-screen display 100% of the time, without the ability to remove it. You used to have to tap to bring up these buttons so you could use 100% of the display, now you can't hide them. Amazon: take a note;. When you have 3 inches of screen real estate. It's all precious. Don't put up onscreen display that you can't hide. Stay away from this device until they fix this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sam D.

customer_reviews.title: Needs updated
customer_reviews.text: The physical product is great. Love it! BUT THE FIRMWARE NEEDS TO BE UPDATED!! "Things to try" needs to be GONE. The clock faces need to be more customizable. Like putting the weather on the clock face, more digital options, and dates. Different fonts. Ect...and a white noise option like the Google home has would be very nice. Rain, thunder, wind, and heavy rain.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Welch

customer_reviews.title: buggy, annoying - don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: This product and the companion app are incredibly buggy. Flickering screen, missed alarms, software updates overnight, etc. The mobile app is barely usable for setting alarms. I’m shocked it was ever released. Trust me, do not buy it. Support will not help you - they will just run you in circles and they don’t even understand the software running on their own product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T.

customer_reviews.title: Oh, Amazon, why can't I use the Echo Spot as a CLOCK?!
customer_reviews.text: Great product EXCEPT there is no possible way for it to act as a clock the displays the time PERMANENTLY. When in 'Clock' mode, the screen rotates between the clock face and a 'Things to Try' screen. I intended on buying several units for my house, but I do not need a screen in the house that is permanently trying to upset me. Acting as clock should be a BASIC feature of the Echo Spot. How could you get this wrong, Amazon?? #FAIL
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Rotating Digital Billboard in your Bedroom
customer_reviews.text: It now rotating a "Things to try screen" which cannot be shut off, despite what it is being told to do in the settings. This is like having a very small digital billboard on you nightstand constantly advertising to you - day and night. Not what I signed up for. If this isn't fixed ASAP (this wasn't always like this) I will return the two units that I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Scherber

customer_reviews.title: Things to try ---- GET RID OF IT
customer_reviews.text: The echo works fine but then you get indundated with "Things to try". I am not a 10 year old that needs stimulus to tell me to do things. I found there is no way to turn this off except for .... turning off the screen. If I cannot find a suitable fix for this it goes back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Moss

customer_reviews.title: This by far is the BEST Echo EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not one for reviews but I just had to write this. This thing is a work of art. My whole house is a smart house from my locks to my thermostats. I have 1 Echo, 4 Echo Dots and now one Echo Spot. I love this. It works as expected. I am a total Apple Guy but I choose Alexa over Siri any day. Amazon has knocked it out of the park!
customer_reviews.author: Apple Guy

customer_reviews.title: Can’t turn off “Things to Try”
customer_reviews.text: The product is attractive and somewhat useful, BUT, Amazon chose to force users to view their “things to try” and Trending”. This greatly depreciates the value of the product. Do not buy unless you are willing to view a billboard from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: toshidon

customer_reviews.title: Alexa is looking SEXY!
customer_reviews.text: Alexa is looking better than ever! I love having this little screen besides my bed! Asking her to show me movie trailers, set alarms, and make calles has never been better! I made a video review on this little guys! Check it out and I hope this helps one of you interested in buying Cheers
customer_reviews.author: MindSeedTV

customer_reviews.title: Can’t remove “things to try” from homescreen rotation!!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the Echo Spot except for the fact that you can not remove “things to try” from the clock screen rotation. I want it to cycle between the time and weather, and any other items I enable. Why cannot the “things to try” be disabled like all the other items (notifications, reminders, etc)
customer_reviews.author: Derron

customer_reviews.title: Cannot disable the despised Things To Try screen. Don’t buy until this is changed.
customer_reviews.text: Product forces user to review Alexa Things to Try. There is no way to disable it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Eli

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Glitchy at best
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Glitchy at best. Would stop responding all together . Problem connecting to Bose WiFi speakers . Would freez in need of hard rebooting. Alarm would not work. Voice command non responsive . My other two Alexa’s never had any of these problems Received a call from amazon from a bice representative 1/2 hour after my review. He was patient To walk me through fixing the issue. Unfortunately after all the work we did. Alexa is still in responsive ......
customer_reviews.author: Glen S.

customer_reviews.title: Bought the spot and loved it. Within months it started acting funny and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the spot and loved it. Within months it started acting funny and would stop working—called and they determined that it was overheating. I was told to unplug and technical support would call within 24-48 hours. Waited 48 hours without response and replied to email and was asked to wait a week. A week goes by with absolutely no response so I do the inline chat per instructions. Told to wait longer. REALLY???? Unacceptable—expected more from Amazon. Find it funny how they always thank me for being a Prime member but when an issue arises I cannot even get assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My newly purchased Echo Spot will not pair with the ...
customer_reviews.text: My newly purchased Echo Spot will not pair with the Bose Soundlink Mini II. I have tried all known steps gleaned from the Internet and both the Bose and Amazon Information Sites. I know the problem is not with the Bose since it connects perfectly with my "big" echo, my iPhone, and iPad. I have a friend that ordered a Spot and I plan on trying to pair it with the Bose. If it pairs, my Spot will be going back for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Lance P

customer_reviews.title: whhhhat
customer_reviews.text: this thing has a mind of it's own and it won't stop repeating the morning flash briefing to me. i'm a tech-savvy person and have tried everything, looked in every forum, downloaded apps to help with alexa's skills and still no luck. i literally ONLY get the flash briefing every morning out of this and occasionally the time if i look over at it. i'm so mad i spent my money on it :(
customer_reviews.author: bsg85

customer_reviews.title: The dreaded flicker...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 spots back in Nov. 2018. About a month or two ago, two of the dot screens started flickering. It stinks because I like the spots overall, but to have 2 of them start to malfunction in less than 2 years is unacceptable. I also have not seen any responses from Amazon to address this issue and it's been a major complaint from tons of customers. Because of that, I can't recommend this item. I'm sure it's only a matter of time before my 3rd spot starts flickering. I will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: yolli71

customer_reviews.title: Flickering display
customer_reviews.text: Within few months the screen started flickering. Called Amazon and they promptly provided shipping label to ship it for warrenty repair. In few days got email that SW is updated and spot is being shipped back. Received it today, plugged it and immediately it started flickering. I am surprised that it was sent back as ‘fixed’, while the problem persists and is easily visible. See attached video.
customer_reviews.author: Rohit

customer_reviews.title: Lots of one star reviews Amazon........
customer_reviews.text: I'll pile on. Like many others, one of our spots is having the screen flicker problem at about 18 months. Outside of warranty, can't find an answer and nothing from Amazon on how to fix it. You would think that something with zero moving parts would last longer than 18 mos but that isn't the case here. We gave up on the Amazon Fire line because it was too clunky but we thought they could at least get an alarm clock right. Wrong. Sorry Amazon, love you guys but you need to step up on these Alexa devices and take responsibility for your quality issues.
customer_reviews.author: Quiteno John

customer_reviews.title: Echo Spot alarm issues
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Spot arrived as scheduled and integrated into my system easily. However, initializing as an alarm had problems. I initially set the alarm OK but turned it off by saying "Alexa cancel alarm" which worked for a couple of days and then NO alarm even though Alexa showed the alarm was still there. I tried with a new alarm with the same result so I contacted technical support. The agent could not help but suggested saying use "Alexa, STOP" which did work, I tried the same alarm on my Echo SHOW which worked perfectly. I could not find any instructions on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Halladay

customer_reviews.title: Screen Flickering June 15, 2020
customer_reviews.text: I bought the device July 2018 and it worked very well. However here we are two years later and the screen is flickering. I have tried all the solutions suggested by Amazon as well as online users to no avail. Looks like it's the mother board. I am a huge user of echo dots, spots, shows, etc. and I'm disappointed that Amazon doesn't stand behind its electronics for more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: gdwmsu

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for awhile now and have so many problems with it. 1. The screen jumps ever 2 seconds 2. The time doesn't show as often as it should. I don't care about "things you should try" 3. I have to ask it 2-3 times to do commands 4. The speaker quality is not great I would avoid this product. Just get the Dot and have an alarm clock next to it. The Dot has a better speaker and it seems to listen better.
customer_reviews.author: Channon

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Integrate Well with Home Automation
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE. Bought this to automate home stereo and tv systems. Incredibly hard to setup. Never fully worked. Spent time on four separate tech support calls, and nobody ever solved issues with this device that were directly advertised as capabilities on the Amazon website. If you want to do questions and answers about the weather or whatever... go ahead and buy the echo as a glorified toy or voice condilled single speaker radio. If you want this device to integrate with home automation, do not recommend this as a purchase. Definitely not ready for prime time. Tech support does not fully understand the system well enough to address involved tech support questions having to do with home automation.
customer_reviews.author: AverageJoe

customer_reviews.title: Died within 8 months!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair, one died suddenly after only 8 months! Told I'll likely get a refurbished one, not a new one. Would you want to have someone else's broken Echo Spot they repaired after only 8 months of use? And they'll warrant the refurb for only the remainder of the warranty. Very disappointed!! Will likely not buy again from a company who returns a used product for a broken one!
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtful

customer_reviews.title: Not stable or reliable
customer_reviews.text: Once the novelty of this device wears off, it's kind of annoying. I use it for waking up to news radio here in NY for traffic and weather reports, but it's not reliable or dependable. The constant software updates are always changing what "skills" will work. For example, recently Tunein was dumped and replaced with Radio.com - which DOES NOT WORK, at least for me This was a huge annoyance and there's no one to complain to. I am going back to my Bose Wave radio as soon as I get home tonight...
customer_reviews.author: SKalata

customer_reviews.title: Can’t Turn Off The Very Annoying Things to Try Messages - Amazon Doesn’t Care
customer_reviews.text: It’s frustrating and insulting that Amazon won’t provide any way to disable the “Try” messages. This is my Echo Spot, I should be able to decide what should and should not appear on the display. Based on many, many other complaints about this issue, it appears that Amazon just doesn’t care about this issue. Someone at Amazon decided to have the Spot push these messages no matter what, with no provision to turn them off. If the goal was to alienate and frustrate Echo users, mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Timazon

customer_reviews.title: I really want to love this...but I can't
customer_reviews.text: It is beautifully designed and built. But the severe lack of customization options makes it not very useful. It works fine as an Echo, but the information displayed in the screen is limited. What really ruins it though is that one cannot turn off the annoying "Try this" suggestions. That is so annoying I am likely going to return the device. I don't need to be told to "ask about dog toys", or "ask what time it is Tokyo", etc. every freaking time I walk by the device. Also, it needs a physical camera cover so one can be assured of privacy in the bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Lance_big_daddy

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Works when it wants to. Camera blocks on its own. Too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Fail!  Major problem with the Echo Spot!!
customer_reviews.text: After approximately one year (and shortly after the warranty runs out) the Echo Spot screen develops a constant flicker. There are MANY, MANY owners reporting this problem (search for 'Echo Spot screen flicker' on the web). To date, Amazon has not taken any responsibility for this design failure and are only offering customers a 15% discount on a new product. In my case, I paid $129 for this device and it started flickering 14 months later. There is no reported fix for the problem. As a loyal Amazon customer, I find the company's total disregard of this problem very disturbing. I am very disappointed and they are about to lose a loyal customer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pacific

customer_reviews.title: I love being able to play Prime videos and music from ...
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Spot is everything I thought it would be, and more. I love being able to play Prime videos and music from what essentially is taking the place of my alarm clock. It’s also great to be able to check in on my various security cameras and control my philips hue lights. The screen is small (as expected) but still has great playback quality. I really like the analog clock faces and it would be great if even more were released for some variety. I can’t think of any drawbacks to this product. It was worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Z

customer_reviews.title: Echo Spot working with a Ring doorbell
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought me the Echo Spot along with a Ring doorbell (and installation). We both thought it would work automatically when the Ring sends notifications. It doesn't. One has to ask Alexa to "show me the front door". Since the Echo connects to the Ring it baffles me why notifications aren't automatic. Also, I don't want Amazon or Google devices listening to what is going on in my house. I unplugged the unit until a software upgrade to fix the problem is released. In the not too distant future, I'll donate it to GoodWill.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Kids can't speak with grandma
customer_reviews.text: If you thought about buying this to let your kids chat with no-smartphone grandma- DON'T!!!! It is impossible unless grandma owns a phone AND has an amazon prime account. While the spot is cute, setting it up to be used with a non phone non prime user is impossible. Even with a prime account, the echo is impossible to set up without it trying to download grandmas contact list. And since non-phone-using grandma doesn't have a contact list, purchasers will be left in LIMBO. Just don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: SmoothSailor

customer_reviews.title: Fixed
customer_reviews.text: Update: They have since corrected video streaming screen. Works well now. Unless I’m missing something, this product is terrible for cloud cam/ video streaming. The zoom and mic buttons are blocking a huge portion of the screen. This was not what was advertised (second photo). I have 10 cloud cams, 5 echo dots, 1 echo show and a Ring doorbell. I thought this would be a great baby monitor on my nightstand. So bummed!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice, but the audio quality for calls is horrible ...
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, but the audio quality for calls is horrible on mine. The echo dot was much, much better. This one is unuseable for calling. It could be that I have a bad sample, though ... I havent looked into that possibility.
customer_reviews.author: A software developer

customer_reviews.title: Can't disable video watching for children.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids. They use it for listening to music and video calling me (their father). Unfortunately, because there is no way to restrict video watching, they were using it to watch cartoons all day. Consequently, even though we love it, we are unable to use it. AMAZON, please add the function to be able to restrict video watching. There is already a "parental control" to limit the ages, but nothing that stops "G" rated cartoons from playing without limit.
customer_reviews.author: Henry T

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn't last -- poor Display !!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything seemed to be a good investment till around 5 to 6 months when this started with a SCREEN FLICKER every couple of seconds. Called it in with support team and got it repaired. And today as it just completes one year, the problem is back again !!!! -- Its not worth what we pay for -- I would suggest - go for the old version - without the screen instead of buying this -- So sorry, I tried this from AMAZON !!!
customer_reviews.author: rsat

customer_reviews.title: Works just like the show - added it without issues
customer_reviews.text: Works just like the show - added it without issues. Minus two stars for it's BLUETOOTH support. It will turn off bluetooth speakers when using the video drop-in feature as well as the "calling" feature. You are stuck using the little speaker it comes with or you will have to plug it into an amplifier using the mini-jack patch cord (Speaker out) connection. Boo on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Time Continuously Flickers
customer_reviews.text: After using the Echo Spot for about one year, the time now flickers continuously. I searched for online help and discovered that many people have had the same problem. After following the advice to reset the spot to factory settings, and then to unplug and re-plug it, the problem had continued. I'm very disappointed to have this product quality flaw.
customer_reviews.author: skw

customer_reviews.title: Functionality isn’t there yet.
customer_reviews.text: The device will drive you insane reading all the ads that cover the screen anytime the device is on. The echo show is your best bet. The spot is better because of size for travel if you need one of the echo devices in that capacity but for a personal or business use save your money and get the show.
customer_reviews.author: KJ Steve

customer_reviews.title: Quality failure
customer_reviews.text: Both my echo show and echo spot displays are dying. Flickering frequently. Amazon doesn't care, I have contacted support multiple times within warranty period and all they ask me to reboot. It works for few days after reboot and they start flickering again. No more display echos from Amazon! All my G displays manufactured by Lenovo working great. Also a lot of Alexa integration fails such as Philips Hue. Only way to get them back working for few days are to remove and reinstate. No more echos in my household. After end of life of the existing dots/shows/spots no more amazon hardware!
customer_reviews.author: The Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: sounds quality is great. working as a nightstand clock is perfect
customer_reviews.text: sounds quality is great. working as a nightstand clock is perfect, with "dimmable" hours you can set for the night. great to have the GUI and full voice and visual whole home intercom. Amazon sets up the device up to your account, unbox and plug in, you will find it already in your Alexa companion app by the time it arrives (in 2 days) at your door step. Who else does that all? Well done Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea R Bianco

customer_reviews.title: screen problems
customer_reviews.text: We have nothing bad to say about our Echo Spot, but then... just over a year old and the screen is having a major issue. It appears like it skipping every few seconds. It still functions, but not something that you can look at for very long without getting a headache. Its kind of like Echo Spot Max Headroom Edition for those old enough to remember. Very disappointing especially considering there is no longer any kind of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Echo Dot Clock Screen Flickers Annoyingly
customer_reviews.text: Bought in April 2018 and has worked adequately. However, in recent months the screen has been flickering: at first not constantly but in recent weeks annoyingly. My other screens including the Echo Show have been fine in that respect. Also, my Kindles, Fire tablet, Apple, and Android screens all seem fine after several years.
customer_reviews.author: Book and Media Lover

customer_reviews.title: Screen Flickers. Defective product.
customer_reviews.text: The screen jumps every 3 seconds. I returned once for repair. Three months later, the problem has returned. They will not refund. I am forced to send for ‘repair’ again.
customer_reviews.author: The Jimp

customer_reviews.title: Not supported for long...
customer_reviews.text: The spot screen started flickering about a year after purchasing. I was told by customer support that it was out of warranty and it wasn’t supported. I thought it should last longer than a year? But I guess not.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled like I was!
customer_reviews.text: Support for this device is appalling. It is difficult to configure and the support staff cannot make it much easier. I purchased two of these Spots, one for my 97-year-old mother, and one for us and her great-grandchildren. She is 1400 miles away from us and there is no way I can remotely manage the device or instruct her how to do it. The ad makes it seem so easy. Just say, "Alexa, call mom!" Don't be fooled!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Albert

customer_reviews.title: NOT cordless
customer_reviews.text: I love the video feature but I feel completely misled by the fact all of the pictures indicate that it’s cordless, but it is not, it’s impossible to use without it being plugged in (I feel very misled by the product images). I wanted to be able to take it from room to room like all other echo products (especially during a video chat), but I have to plug and re-plug it in. Amazon, am I missing something?
customer_reviews.author: Crystal A Keilers

customer_reviews.title: Failure after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in July of 2018 (I’m writing this in Aug of 2019). Screen won’t stop jumping. Contacted customer support and followed instructions for factory reset etc. At the end of exhausting all potential solutions I get the “it’s out of warranty and we can’t help” I know they don’t care but I do spend a lot of money on the site as shopping is limited around me. Simply frustrating how I was treated.

customer_reviews.title: Flickering Screen After 10 Months of Usage Very Annoying
customer_reviews.text: I've generally liked the Spot. Decent sound, good Alexa integration, easy set up, like song lyrics displayed on screen... The major problem is that the screen began flickering after about 10 months of use. I lived with it for 2-3 months and decided to return it for a replacement. I called 2 weeks after the warranty expired. Customer Service was virtually non-responsive, only offering me a small discount on a new purchase. Very disappointed in customer service and in the screen life. It's still usable, but the major feature of this unit is the screen. Seems like a pretty major fail compounded by the lack of Amazon standing behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, but add an extended warrenty if you buy!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed my Echo Spot while it lasted. It looks great, feels solid, sounds relatively good, although not for enjoying music, and it makes a nice "smart" alarm clock. The issue I had was a distracting screen flicker that developed about five months past the one-year warranty expired. After doing some research and attempting a factory reset, I've learned that others have experienced this issue as well. The Spot is a great product, but do yourself a favor and get an extended warranty as well.
customer_reviews.author: Janet D

customer_reviews.title: More useful than standard Echo or Echo dot.
customer_reviews.text: This is much more useful than the original Echo. I have both. I am able to pull up my ring cameras. I was able to ditch the bedside alarm clock, because it shows a clock face and is very good at setting alarms.I was concerned about the sound, but the sound is quite good. I do not need an external speaker. I can play relaxing sounds prior to bed, which helps me sleep. I would give this 4 starts, but I realize the product is evolving and therefore supplied an additional star. I relocated the original echo to the living room and I can use the two devices as an intercom.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Matten

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase..
customer_reviews.text: Bought echo spot on july 2018, after 13 months of use, screen started flickering.. Contacted customer service for help, no replacements or repairs since it passed 1 yr warranty.. A big scam.. Check google for lot of complaints about screen issues once it passes warranty period.. Soon iam trying to file consumer complaint..
customer_reviews.author: Manish N.

customer_reviews.title: Screen flickers, common problem
customer_reviews.text: I have never written a review for an Amazon product before, but I feel the need to warn people thinking of purchasing the Echo Spot. 1 month after the warranty ran out, the screen began flickering and jumping. After an internet search, I found out that this is an incredibly common problem without a known fix (I tried all suggestions I found). Amazon refuses to replace and only offers a trade-in (approximately $30, at most). Given that this is clearly a well-known, common issue, Amazon should really take note and offer to exchange them. I highly recommend you avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Dad

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Wish I got this before the Echo!
customer_reviews.text: The digital screen on the spot is a much better tutorial and introduction to Alexa than the Echo. However, I would have ultimately ended up with both as the Echo has a much better speaker. Not that the one on the spot isnt good too, just better for a bedroom, while you can use the echo to provide music for a small (15 to 20 people) party. Also, I am very sensitive to light and this digital clock Is perfectly dim during sleeping hours, which are customizable.
customer_reviews.author: Karolina

customer_reviews.title: All thumbs, use a stylus
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and shipped this to my dad. He already has echo and echo dot but I like the fact this has a screen but smaller and less expensive than amazon show. Setup was a chore. Me dad had a difficult time with the touchscreen. Maybe it’s his chubby fingers but he has no issue texting on his iPhone. After several attempts, I was observing FaceTime, he finally made it through the WiFi password entry,email entry and password. He’s currently enjoying it in his bedroom and the echo dot has moved to the garage, replacing the radio. P. S. I have ordered him a stylus, in case he needs to make any updates to the spot.
customer_reviews.author: WR8

customer_reviews.title: Was nice for short period of time.
customer_reviews.text: Original I loved it until it started going “ haywire”. The screen flickers over and over and doesn’t stop. Very expensive to have it act this way. Otherwise I would have loved it but apparently doesn’t last long with minimal use, sense it’s used only bedroom and not often beside the clock 5 star customer service Update Amazon took it back and had their IT guys look at it in the end they replaced my original echo. Very happy with customer service. I wish they could take care of all the advertising they do on echo. Hopefully this unit will last! Thank you amazon
customer_reviews.author: Megz

customer_reviews.title: Another Victim of the Screen Flicker Problem After the Spot Warranty Expired
customer_reviews.text: Well, add me to the list of people whose screen started flickering two months after my warranty expired. I am not happy with the Amazon Echo products!! In addition to the Spot problem, two of the video cameras in my Echo Show 5's stopped working this past week and required factory resets. Unbelievable. There seems to be no clear solution for the screen glitch issue. I would not recommend this product to anyone, because the quality is horrible. I have better things to do with my $130 than buy a device that has had a major flaw for months and no available fix from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Old School Terri

customer_reviews.title: Gone crazy after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I have Amazon echos that I love. We bought this for our daughter in December, and this echo is a MESS! It won't respond correctly to commands and it's driving me crazy. I'm going to have to contact Amazon. We spent good money on this unit and it's very aggravating to get her to do basic commands. For instance, I ask her to open WINDS BLOWING for white noise to get my daughter to sleep. Every night I have to work to get her to respond to my command. I ask for it EVERY NIGHT, you would think she would know what I'm talking about by now. Maybe the unit I have is a fluke. But she is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Kelloggs

customer_reviews.title: Won't be buying another!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Spot for just over a year now and the screen just started glitching and jumping out of nowhere. This is the second time an Echo product has glitched on me. The first being an Echo Show, having only owned it less than 6 months. I won't be buying another one and am hoping for a replacement or refund.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Anguiano

customer_reviews.title: Great Alarm Clock and Weather Notifications.
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Spot works perfectly when it’s not really connected to any Smart Home devices. There is a feature where you can tell Echo Spot to turn of its screen, I do this at night), however, when I have my dyson connected or some other device connected and I ask Echo Spot to turn off its screen, she just reply’s “Sorry, what device.” And this can go on forever. I found that I had to disconnect everything in order to avoid that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Steven V

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in the bedroom
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that the screen would be too bright for the bedroom at night. Fear not! The screen gets really dark and is not at all intrusive at night.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Great little device - sadly screen started flickering after a year of use
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set up, usable small screen, great with all of the Alexa features in such a compact unit. Screen and sound is fine as an alarm clock - plug in an external amp/speaker system if you want decent audio. The biggest downside is long-term internal component reliability. It worked great for the entire warranty period however after a year the display started flickering irritatingly once a second (see video). Amazon troubleshooting help suggests unplugging the unit for 3 minutes then reconnecting - this does NOT correct this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Waterhouse

customer_reviews.title: Its good unless you have a BOSE Speaker
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dots, i wanted a spot for the kitchen. Initially i thought this was the best thing ever until i asked it the weather and it didnt respond! I figured out if i play music then stop the music to ask a question the answer does not come out of my connected Bose speaker! this is a major flaw in my opinion. I called Amazon who have not figured out why this does not work, i put my complaint in 7 months ago! Apart from this major flaw its great, but if you play lots of music and have a bose speaker, this may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Harding

customer_reviews.title: NO OPTION FOR SPANISH
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THIS TO COMMUNICATE WITH MY MOTHER, WHO DOESN'T SPEAK ENGLISH. TURNS OUT IT DOESN'T UNDERSTAND, OR SPEAK SPANISH. NO OPTION AVAILABLE FOR SPANISH LANGUAGE SET UP, DESPITE THE FACT MANY REVIEWS SAY IT DOES... WELL, THE ALEXA APP HAS NO OPTION FOR THAT LANGUAGE. IT'S SAD THAT MANY HISPANICS LIVE IN THE USA, AND MANY AROUND THE WORLD WHO PURCHASE FROM AMAZON HELPING ITS PROFIT. I THINK IT'S TIME TO UPLOAD THIS LANGUAGE AMAZON, OR GOOGLE, NETFLIX, AND SMARTPHONES WILL BE A BETTER CHOICE OFFERING MOST LANGUAGE TRANSLATIONS TODAY...
customer_reviews.author: maggie perez

customer_reviews.title: Screen begins to flicker just barely outside 1yr warranty
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in March 2018. July 2019 the screen begins to flicker and jump around. Works well when it works. Would be happy to get a refurb replacement but that isn't given to me as an option. This is an expensive device and shouldn't be treated as hey buy another one. Reeks of planned obsolescence.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Echo Spot died
customer_reviews.text: My Amazon Echo Spot died in a little more than a year. Just outside of the guarantee period, of course. Black screen, cannot do a factory reset. Nothing. It is probably due to a system update screw up. Amazon does not offer a fix and the tech support people pretend that they have never heard anything like this before. TERRIBLE customer support from Amazon. 👎👎👎
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Screen flicker
customer_reviews.text: In addition to the Things to Try issue so many others have mentioned, our started to have screen flicker. Quick research showed us hundreds and hundreds of people with the same issue. This thing has been babied and in about a year developed the flicker. On the market now for new smart alarm you should be too. Skip this. Audio is poor, screen is tiny and used up by amazon ads.
customer_reviews.author: Tomusama

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT purchase the Spot!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these! I bought 4 and screens are blinking out of control a week past their warranty. Amazon will NOT replace them!! They will only give you a discount for another one. I took the discount and purchased another one which didn't work at all. Returned the "new" one immediately and just threw the other blinky ones out!
customer_reviews.author: Ilene Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Screen died a week out of warranty?!
customer_reviews.text: It's almost like they planned it. The screen has started flickering every second or so. Rebooting has no effect. It's incredibly disruptive. My device was literally a little over a week out of warranty when this started, and they were able to provide no help except a 15% off coupon for a new one. Feels skeevy. I've liked it, but I don't know if I'll spend 100 dollars on a new alarm clock when there are so many other awesome ones on the market. UPDATE: I griped and Amazon replaced it. So that's something.
customer_reviews.author: Tisiphone

customer_reviews.title: Amazon needs to update the firmware urgently.
customer_reviews.text: The extremely annoying “things to try” card that is impossible to get rid off is driving me absolutely crazy. If I didn’t have to pay $130 for this junk it would be flying out my window right now. Very slow, screen flickers when accessing settings, the volume for “media” is not for only for media as it should be, is also for Alexa and other sounds all mixed up into one control.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Q.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment. Unable to connect Echo Spot via Bluetooth to ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointment. Unable to connect Echo Spot via Bluetooth to my Bose deck using the Bluetooth adapter I have. The adapter works perfectly with my iPhone and iPad. Yes, I can use the aux plug to connect but not what I hoped for. Nor do I want to limit all audio to the Bose Deck. 99% of all questions I ask I get an " I do not know answer". Watch faces a major disappointment. I am keeping the Echo Spot because it was a gift. The 2nd generation Echo a much better value.
customer_reviews.author: Sprsteel

customer_reviews.title: 1 year review - Device review not Alexa review
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best version of Amazon's Echo offerings. So why the 3 star rating? I'm not reviewing the Alexa technology, just simply the device. The screen has started to flicker at about the rate of once every two seconds. If I restart the device, the flicker is cleared for a short time (2 or 3 days) but inevitably returns. UPDATE: Since the device was still under warranty, Amazon was as usual, extremely helpful in getting my issue resolved.
customer_reviews.author: csciguy

customer_reviews.title: FAILING AFTER 1 YEAR
customer_reviews.text: Really REALLY disappointed in Amazon - I have bought 6 of these and last month one of them after 13 months, started to flicker and fail. I called Amazon and was told the warranty had expired and they couldn't do anything. Now ALL of them have started to do the same thing!! It's like they have some type of system fail built into them to fail after just a year. I had done so much research in an alarm clock that would do more and regretfully replaced another alarm clock that I had had for over 30 years - that still worked!! SHAME ON YOU AMAZON FOR SELLING CRAP!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Not enough functionality to be worth the price right now
customer_reviews.text: For as awesome as the Echo and Echo Dots are, the Spot is a disappointment. There is very little control over what the screen shows, what the clock looks like, what order things show up in, etc. At this point if I hadn't thrown the box away immediately, I would have sent it back and just got another full size Echo.
customer_reviews.author: Don Pattee

customer_reviews.title: Screen flicker issue is real!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in July 2018, writing this August 2019 - just out of warranty. Everything was great until I got the dreaded screen flicker on the Spot. I’ve tried all troubleshooting, resetting, unplugging, etc. No dice. See video for example. Check your favorite search engine for “Echo Spot screen flicker” and see all of the complaints. Device reliability aside, I did love it. Shame that something has affected hundreds, of not thousands of people reporting the same screen flicker issues with their Echo Spots
customer_reviews.author: MESTASCCHIO

customer_reviews.title: One year = junk screen
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why it started doing it, but the screen on the Spot is fritzing out. It shows the time in two different places except for the one that's not supposed to be there keeps blinking in and out. It's kind of like a '90s Hollywood computer virus. Even the classic "turn-it-off-and-on-again" trick didn't work. This thing is full-on Jurassic Parked. Otherwise, the Spot has worked great up until it started having issues with the screen, which conveniently occurred just outside of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: jmerc

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year and half with this echo and now the screen is starting to act funny. It keeps jumping up and down. I wish things would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Cintron

customer_reviews.title: Notice some "Drop in" sound quality problems....
customer_reviews.text: 4 out of 5 stars. I have the Original Tall Echo, 4 dots, 2 spots and 1 Show. The only thing I'm finding a problem with is the speakers in the Spot. when using Drop In. Sometimes I'm not being heard on the other spot and vice versa. The voices tends break up or the sound coming through is intermittent. The optical is fine........ it's just the sound. Sometimes I'll have to repeat the wake word 2-3 times and I'm only 8 feet away plus it's on one of those $20 stands. I find the ECHO DOT, Original echo and the Show has much better sound quality. That's one reason I bought the Echo Show.
customer_reviews.author: LwosTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Echo Spot
customer_reviews.text: You cannot play specific songs that you purchased on these devices unless you pay for amazon music unlimited, making this useless for playing music of your choice. So they intentionally cripple this device unless you keep paying them money. Plus you constantly have to repeat commands. It was tolerable when I could use it to play music of my choice simultaneously on all devices. Now this device is useless because it’s often easier and faster to do things myself than to wait for Alexa to understand commands.
customer_reviews.author: Shanda

customer_reviews.title: Flickering screen
customer_reviews.text: I brought this product Feb. 2018, Now (08/19) the screen started to flicker. I did everything recommended in the Amazon Support groups ( From unplug to reset and so on) but nothing worked. Not eligible for return or replacement. After spending $148 dollars the product last less than two years. REALLY? Is this the type of product that Amazon sells to loyal costumers? Very disappointed !! Ettore ADDENDUM: Within the two hours of posting this review, Amazon contacted me. They sent a new Echo Spot to replace the defective one. VERY HAPPY now
customer_reviews.author: Ettore

customer_reviews.title: Great device but developed screen flicker/jump just outside of warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Generally happy with device but developed the screen flicker/jump problem after 14 months. I started hearing about this problem about 5 months ago. Very disappointed to wake up this morning to see the screen jumping every 2 second. Very distracting even on the clock face. I primarily use this device for viewing my ring doorbell camera when I'm at home. The jump renders the device virtually useless for this purpose. Just reached out to Amazon. Hoping they will do something even outside of warranty because it is a known issue that is becoming very common. Great device otherwise. If considering purchase if advice contacting customer support to see if they resolved this issue on current production models.
customer_reviews.author: K-9

customer_reviews.title: Can function as a cat toy!
customer_reviews.text: Aside from all the positives, including fuller sound than a dot, a crisp display and a perfect bedside form factor - it can also play videos of birds which my cat absolutely loves. I’ll probably be picking up a glass screen protector
customer_reviews.author: iamaustin

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying flicker
customer_reviews.text: Echo Spot started flickering just after the one year warranty expired. All the online articles on how to stop the flicker have failed. It seems it is a design flaw in the circuitry where not enough power is given to the screen. Was a useful device until this annoying bug started. If Amazon cannot stand behind its product designs, it hardly seems worth investing in them.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Philipp

customer_reviews.title: Screen flickers - cannot be fixed (see forum - issue NOT RESOLVED)
customer_reviews.text: I tried several "fixes" and nothing worked... do not get one with a screen for this is an issue with ALL echo devices that has a screen. You won't see it when it's new but it starts to happen in about a year.  - issue is NOT RESOLVED. (from the forum including latest post from Sept 2019:) - Amazon will NOT replace your device, they may give you a small discount to replace it - Amazon closed the thread as if this was resolved - it was after an update from Amazon that this started to go bad - Amazon may be able to pressure their vendors to refund returns but they certainly don't do it on their products
customer_reviews.author: 火龍

customer_reviews.title: Screen flickers, just after warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: We have the original Alexa, plus three Dots, two Cameras, several plugs, a Show and a Spot. The Spot screen started flickering just after the 1-year warranty expired. Might be a software glitch, but it's been months and it hasn't gone away. I'm not the only one with this problem -- search "screen flicker" and a boatload turn up. Also, neither the Spot nor the Show have the color-ring -- which tell you whether you have a delivery or a message -- like the non-screen Alexa's do. Skip this model...
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan

customer_reviews.title: Screen flickering since around December
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked decent until around December wgen the screen began flickering. I have been looking up for possible foxes amd see that tgis os a common occurrence on these and no update on a fix, Amazon believes that it may be due to a software update (except that it isn't fixed by a hard reset). Think twice before spending money on one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Shabazz

customer_reviews.title: After one year its getting ready to die I think
customer_reviews.text: The display is starting to flicker. Every 2 seconds. A bit annoying, but all other functions work. There is an Amazon support forum with many other users reporting the same issue. Tech support from Amazon has no resolve to the problem. If you email or call them, they want to give you a 15 percent discount if you buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: John Fischer IV

customer_reviews.title: Flickering
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this device. I use it as an alarm clock. But after owning it 11 months it began to flicker non stop. I tried everything (deregistering, factory resets, unplugging) to get it to stop, but nothing worked. Since it was still under warranty I sent it in to Amazon. They repaired it and all was well for 100 days, and then the flickering started again. But repairs only have a 90 day warranty, and since I was now outside the one year warranty, I had no recourse. Basically I am stuck with a flickering device that no longer can be repaired by Amazon. A quick search of flickering, will yield many reviews with the same complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for the bedroom...if it works properly!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 of these Echo Spots year or so ago. One works very well in our bedroom. The other unit however, has a flaw we discovered in the display. It jumps around....we did not notice when this started happening because it is in our guest bedroom. We have unplugged and detached from wifi but nothing seems to fix. Hate to see this because we have Dot's, Show, and Echo, all working just fine...as is our master bedroom Spot. Warranty was up in May it seems..
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L Phillippe

customer_reviews.title: Gives You More
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Spot at the same time I purchased two Echo Shows, thinking this would be a good alternative where space is limited. I have found it to be useful for some things such as setting reminders, kitchen timer, weather reports and more. It is more than the Echo Dot because the screen gives you more information or makes working with it easier. An example would be when you ask for weather the audio give you some information for the screen gives additional information like the weather for the next few days. I haven't used it enough to compare to the echo show, so the jury is still out. The price does make it attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I am huge Amazon fan! First to have a kindle and the echo. I waited a bit on this but have wanted it for awhile. I do love it!! My kids love it! They love watching videos and the lyrics to the songs. Now the video calling feature is nothing like how the advertisement made it out. I thought as long as someone would FaceTime me I could do it through that and I can’t. It’s Spot to Spot. Can’t even Skype (which I do often with my aunt). The is my major disappointment with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn R. DeCaria

customer_reviews.title: So far I really do love it. The only reason I gave it only ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I really do love it. The only reason I gave it only 4 stars and not 5 was because I was very surprised at how little the options are for clock face. There is only two options for just a " regular " digital face. The other faces are analog in different genetic backgrounds . Most of the numbers on those Analog clocks are so small you can't read them from 3 feet away. I found only two in which the numbers were ok. I hope there are future options for people who don't want to have to put their glasses on just to get out of bed THEN Read the clock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Screen Flickers
customer_reviews.text: After a few months the screen started flickering. I reset the device but that only fixed the problem for a few hours. The flickering is enough to keep me from using the screen. It's terrible. I basically have a really expensive and annoying Echo Spot. And it turns out the screen is too small to be useful (to me), but I don't use it for video or looking in on other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Zenfur

customer_reviews.title: "Things to Try" Ad Sucks
customer_reviews.text: "Things to Try" fills the screen after you change a setting or give it a command. None of the suggested settings disables it. Unbelievable that they won't allow that "feature" to be turned off. It's a good wifi clock, but I'm too irritated with it to write about the other aspects. I don't know why others give 5 star reviews when something so easily addressed remains an issue. I received two as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sensitive

customer_reviews.title: Screen starts flickering after a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: Screen starts flickering after a few months of use and Amazon would not recognize the fact that this is a widespread issue. Based on other people's reviews, this looks to be the case. The issue seems to be hardware related, Amazon support knows a factory reset, power cycle or any other online recommendations don't fix the issue, so they issue replacements for the units, but I understand sooner or later all devices end up having this problem.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was totally against having smart tech in my home but it’s honestly so much easier to just ask her the weather while searching through my closet than having to stop everything to look it up. I like that amazon music often provides on screen lyrics to many songs (though has a limited song collection). I also love being able to make video calls bc it has much better reliability and clearer voices than phone video calls. My roommate has several Google homes in the house, both standard and minis, and though the audio quality for music is better on google, everything else is better with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problems shortly after warranty expired!!!
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year and 3 months of VERY light use of this device, there are problems to include the constant flickering of the screen. Sat in the same spot with the original plugin used. Amazon was not able to help resolve the issue. Offered 15% off a new device but I don't plan on buying one every 15 months. Stinks that it only lasted that long. UPDATE 08/20/19: Amazon contacted after review and had me send in old Echo and replaced with a new one. Gave an additional star. Will wait to see how this one performs before changing rating again.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth F.

customer_reviews.title: Think twice...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought it would be a cute and handy alarm clock. I loved it, absolutely loved it....for about a year. Then the screen starting messing up. It flickers (very, very noticeably) about every 5 to 10 seconds. Its annoying, and pretty much ruins the whole thing for me. It is a known issue, I have seen many other people complain about this. Of course it is outside the warranty time frame, so Amazon is refusing to do anything about it. Think twice before buying.
customer_reviews.author: rainlondon

product_meta.title: Echo Spot - Smart Alarm Clock with Alexa - White
feature_bullets: Compact 2.5" smart display with Alexa ready to help
Alexa is always happy to help - Manage your day. Get instant information. Check weather and traffic on your way out.
Voice control your music - Ask Alexa to play music and see lyrics with Amazon Music. Also, stream music from Apple Music, Spotify, Pandora, and other music services, or books from Audible.
Control your smart home - Voice control compatible devices or manage them on the easy-to-use display. Ask Alexa to show you security cameras, control lights, and adjust thermostats.
Connect with video calling and messaging - Make video calls to family and friends with Skype, the Alexa app, an Echo Spot, or Echo Show.
Alexa has skills - With tens of thousands of skills and counting, Alexa is always getting smarter and adding new skills like tracking fitness, playing games, and more.
Designed to protect your privacy - Electronically disconnect the microphones and camera with one press of a button.
